title: New Jersey couple's engagement is accidentally captured by NBC New York during their storm coverage
text:
Viewers got a heartwarming surprise when NBC New York captured the sweet moment a New Jersey couple became engaged during the station's weather coverage.

Reporter Brian Thompson was at the Jersey Shore covering a storm expected to drench the tri-state area when camera's accidentally captured a marriage proposal.

According to NBC 4, Tyler Osborne brought his girlfriend Lisa Snyder back to the exact spot they shared their first kiss 15 months ago.

NBC New York reporter Brian Thompson was completing a weather segment at the Jersey Shore when camera's captured a engagement in real time (pictured)

Tyler Osborne (right) brought his girlfriend of 15 months, Lisa Snyder (left), to the exact spot they have their first kiss to pop the question

Luckily, Snyder (left) was thrilled and said yes before the couple sweetly embraced in front of cameras

This time, Osborne dropped on one knee.

In the video, Osborne pulls out the ring as the waves crash behind the Highland couple and the wind blows their hair.

Lisa excitedly says yes and the pair have a visible gleam in their eye as they speak to Thompson.

Their engagement happened to fall on Snyder's (left) 30th birthday, giving the Highland based couple more reasons to celebrate

Osborne (middle) told Thompson (left) he's wanted to marry Snyder (right), 'Since the second I met her. No doubt'

The couple says they've known marriage was in their stars since the first day they met.

'Since the second I met her. No doubt,' Tyler says. 'There was no doubt in my mind.’

The marriage proposal also happened to fall on Lisa's 30th birthday, giving the couple another reason to celebrate.
description: NBC New York accidentally captured a New Jersey couples' engagement at the Jersey Shore when reporter Brian Thompson was doing a segment for the station's weather coverage
